Author: rsynnott
Content: In languages which have decent ones, certainly. Of the five languages this library seems to work for, only C++ has any sort of macros at all, as far as I know...

Author: rsynnott
Content: I suspect Google's AdSense ads are a better model. I've actually seen _useful_ ones!

Author: bootload
Content:
Added because the tool companies [0] are now catching up. What does this mean to web2.0 companies? Well it means the playing field is being leveled [1] , the market is maturing and the toolset will allow even more competition.

Reference

[0] In this case Borland or Codegear. The spin-off name for the Borland tools division.

[1] Even more so with the release of Borland for PHP ~ http://tinyurl.com/39gkcc\nand VCL for PHP ~ http://sourceforge.net/projects/vcl4php/

Author: rsynnott
Content: Well, in the abstract, it's quite a hard problem. If they asked him how to clean a particular variety of coffee maker, that would be easier. :)

Author: jsjenkins168
Content:
That is not an issued patent, but rather an editited application. There is a good discussion of this on /. The consensus is that this will almost certainly NOT get approved, and that GWT is prior art (used internally at Google since 2004).

Like PG says, it would never stand up in court, even if the USPTO actually approved it.\n
